column4: Is it normal for cpu load to always be at 100%, in Fedora it sat at 3% all the time
what does 'top' say is using all the cpu?
it was open, but perhaps not visible
can't be seen?  are you sure you have build-essential installed?
I have everything in the prerequisites. I have not installed build-essential
gcc works now, it was unknown before. I thought build-essentials was a download
yes, so you didn't have build-essential's prerequisites installed, you had some other packages which it doesn't care about
you know all that package does is produce a .deb of your kernel, right?
why are you buliding a new kernel to begin with?
I was going to examine the bloatedness of my current one and determine if I am going to build my own
no, there's no point at all
my own kernel. Sorry and Thanks
